s.text: Now, Mundell also went on to work on--or speculate on--the supply-side effects of tax cuts, and this work was obviously important to the Reaganauts.
Now, Mundell also went on to work on--or speculate on--the supply-side effects of tax cuts, and this work was obviously important to the Reaganauts.

And yet just 15 pages later, in the very same issue, Paul Craig Roberts, among the truest of the supply-side cadre's true believers, begins his column with these words: "Robert A. Mundell's Nobel Prize has deprived supply-side economics of its voodoo status."
gained control of policy" and saved the world.
